description 1: This scrapbook, which consists of 217 images, was assembled by Pi Beta Phi Settlement School Head Resident Evelyn Bishop between 1919 and 1925. This book is currently housed in the Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts archives.

subject 1: Pi Beta Phi Settlement School -- Community outreach
description 1: This scrapbook, which consists of 139 images, was assembled by Pi Beta Phi Settlement School teacher and Tacoma, Washington native Ruth Sturley in 1919. The book chronicles Sturley's nine month tenure in Gatlinburg, and includes images of the Settlement School, students, neighboring homesteads, and mountain vistas. It is currently housed in the archives of the Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts.
